tuv.seg: How marriage changes your legal status
An Tionchar a bheidh ag pósadh ar stádas
Marriage gives rise to many far-reaching legal consequences and there are various areas in which being married will affect your entitlements and obligations
Tagann go leor torthaí fad téarmacha san áireamh de bharr an phósta agus tá raon réimsí ina bhfuil éifeacht a bheith ar do chuid cearta agus do chuid dualgais
A father who is married to the mother of his child, has automatic guardianship rights of his child
Bíonn cearta uathoibríocha caomhnóireachta ar a leanbh ag athair atá pósta le máthair a linbh
Unmarried fathers do not have automatic rights
Ní bhíonn cearta uathoibríocha ag aithreacha neamhphósta
Describes the issues relating to inheritance in marriage
Braitheann do chearta oidhreachta ó do chéile/phairtí ar do stádas pósta
In certain situations, married couples in Ireland may be entitled to certain social welfare benefits or allowances not available to unmarried people
Cur síos ar chuid de na hathruithe a bheidh ar do theidealachtaí Leasa Shóisialaigh de bharr do stádas pósta
Taxation of married people and civil partners
Gearradh cánach ar dhaoine pósta in Éirinn
There are three ways in which you can be taxed as a married person
Tá trí bhealach inar féidir cáin a ghearradh ort mar dhuine pósta in Éirinn
Explore the options and find out how to apply
Déan iniúchadh ar na roghanna agus faigh amach cén chaoi iarratas a dhéanamh
This document is in: Money and Tax > Tax > Income tax
This document is in: Airgead agus Cáin > Cáin > Cáin ioncaim
Becoming an Irish citizen through marriage or civil partnership
Ag éirí i do shaoránach Éireannach trí phósadh nó pháirtnéireacht sibhialta
If you are a non-Irish national who is married to or in a civil partnership with an Irish citizen, you may be able to become an Irish citizen if you fulfil certain conditions

Más náisiúnach neamh-Éireannach tú atá pósta nó i bpáirtnéireacht sibhialta le saoránach Éireannach agus má chomhlíonann tú coinníollacha áirithe, b'fhéidir go mbeidh tú i dteideal éirí i do shaoránach Éireannach
This document is in: Moving Country > Irish citizenship
This document is in: Ag bogadh tíre > Saoránacht
Residence rights of family members
Cearta cónaithe do bhaill teaghlaigh
Foreign nationals who move to Ireland may be entitled to bring their family to live with them
D’fhéadfaidh náisiúnaigh eachtrannacha a bhogann go hÉirinn i ndteideal a gclann a thabhairt chun cónaí leo anseo
This document is in: Moving Country > Moving to Ireland > Rights of residence in Ireland
This document is in: Ag bogadh tíre > Teacht go hÉirinn > Cearta Cónaithe in Éirinn
Details of the arrangements to give access to employment for spouses, partners and dependants of non-EEA nationals who are holders of Critical Skills Employment Permits and researchers

Mionsonraí na socruithe le teacht ar fhostaíocht a dhéanamh do chéilí, do pháirtnéirí agus do chleithiúnaigh shaoránaigh neamh-LEE atá ina sealbhóirí Ceada Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhachtacha nó taighdeoirí
This document is in: Employment > Migrant workers > Employment permits
This document is in: Fostaíocht > Oibrithe imirceacha > Ceadanna fostaíochta

Ábhar is mó éilimh i "Teaghlach agus Caidrimh"
Registrars of Births, Marriages and Deaths
Leanaí agus cearta in Éirinn

Orduithe Urchoisc, Sábháilteachta agus Cosanta
